competencyText.en-us: Grade 6-8
Accounting
Demonstrate an understanding of the accounting career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the accounting career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the accounting career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in the accounting career pathway.
Research the history of the accounting career pathway and describe how the careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter a career in the accounting career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the accounting career pathway.
Banking Services
Demonstrate an understanding of the banking services career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the banking services career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the banking services career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in the banking services career pathway.
Research the history of the banking services career pathway and describe how the careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter a career in the banking services career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the banking services career pathway.
State the banking concept as used in America.
Identify the basic functions of banks.
Describe the services offered by a full service bank.
Explain the importance of selling financial services by all financial institutions.
Summarize global banking functions.
Describe the promotion of global trade.
Analyze the global credit crisis.
Identify global exchange services.
Business Finance
Demonstrate an understanding of the business finance career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the business finance career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the business finance career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in the business finance career pathway.
Research the history of the business finance career pathway and describe how the careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter a career in the business finance career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the business finance career pathway.
Compare the differences between the various economic systems and explore American capitalism.
Describe the terms "market" and "market system."
Describe the characteristics of America’s market economy and the impact of supply and demand.
Explain the role of the profit motive in investment decisions.
Compare and contrast major features of a variety of economic systems.
Demonstrate knowledge through citing examples of capital markets and the role securities have within these markets.
Identify reasons for corporate efforts to raise capital.
Explain methods available to corporations for raising capital.
Develop skill in interpreting the financial section of the daily newspaper.
Identify important financial data components found in the financial section of a daily newspaper.
Supplemental
Identify and explore careers in the Finance cluster.
Identify the pathways in the Finance career cluster and the careers in each pathway.
Describe the types of places that employ individuals who have careers in the Finance career cluster.
Describe the variety of tasks performed by individuals who have careers in the Finance career cluster.
List the skills, abilities, and talents needed for careers in the Finance career cluster.
Identify the level of training and education required for careers in the Finance career cluster.
Research a career in the Finance career cluster and present findings to the class.
Apply math, science, and reading skills in the completion of a project or activity related to the Finance career cluster.
Demonstrate ability in using computer and electronic skills to perform job functions.
Apply appropriate tools to increase work efficiency (e.g. word processing, database, spreadsheet programs, presentation programs, email systems, and internet).
Utilize computer technology to access, analyze and interpret business information.
Cite internet-based resources using proper format.
Research industry trends using the Internet.
Develop sales and marketing fundamentals.
Demonstrate knowledge of available financial services and products.
Recognize consumer motivation related to buying behaviors (i.e. demographic, geographic and socioeconomic data).
Explain the importance of and demonstrate the procedures of cross selling.
Identify the opportunities for cross selling.
Follow effective procedures for closing a sale.
Demonstrate the ability to sell a variety of financial services and products.
Develop awareness of management functions and organizational structures as they relate to today’s workplace and employer/employee roles.
Explore and evaluate organizational structures and cultures for managing project teams.
Explore and identify current trends in business and the employee’s role in maintaining productive business environments in today’s global workplace.
Collaborate with individuals and teams to practice tasks and solve business-related problems, demonstrating initiative, courtesy, loyalty, honesty, cooperation, and punctuality.
Assess personal strengths and weaknesses related to job objectives, career exploration, personal development, and life goals.
Analyze job and career pathways and requirements.
Evaluate and relate career interest opportunities in financial occupations in the global economy.
Identify different types of business organizations.
Compare the features of proprietorship, partnership, and corporation.
List the advantages and disadvantages of forming a corporation.
Discuss reasons for corporate acquisitions and mergers.
Describe the role of consumer credit in today's society.
Define consumer credit.
Identify major providers of consumer credit.
Identify the reasons consumer credit exists.
Identify the principles of saving and borrowing.
Describe the importance of credit to consumers in the American marketplace.
List the criteria for evaluating an individual's credit worthiness.
Describe three different types of consumer credit discrimination.
Describe a strategy for increasing an individual's savings.
Define global trade.
Describe what takes place during the rise or fall of the exchange rate of the U.S. dollar.
Outline the advantages and disadvantages of a protectionist policy.
Identify possible solutions to the problem of meeting global competition.
Distinguish between imports and exports.
Discuss the U.S. balance of trade.
Demonstrate initiative, courtesy, loyalty, honesty, cooperation and punctuality as a team member.
Practice tasks as a team member to solve business-related problems, demonstrating initiative, courtesy, loyalty, honesty, cooperation, and punctuality.
Insurance
Demonstrate an understanding of the insurance career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the insurance career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the insurance career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in the insurance career pathway.
Research the history of the insurance career pathway and describe how the careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter a career in the insurance career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the insurance career pathway.
Securities and Investments
Demonstrate an understanding of the securities and investments career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the securities and investments career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the securities and investments career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in the securities and investments career pathway.
Research the history of the securities and investments career pathway and describe how the associated careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter a career in the securities and investments career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the securities and investments career pathway.
